file_content.text: Hurry! Get to the bridge!
Excuse me? Yes, could I speak with you for a moment?
You're a soldier--Republic Army, right? I'm sorry to bother you, but I was wondering if you've been contacted by any of the ship's officers.
I have not been contacted by any of the ship's personnel. Is there a situation?
Negative, ma'am.
Some passengers from Ord Mantell mentioned your reputation as a first-rate pilot. Has the ship's crew spoken to you?
I don't normally do civilian transport, but I could definitely get this hunk of metal to Coruscant faster.
Are they hiring?
No, no. I'm sorry, that isn't quite what I meant.
I don't mean to trouble you, Jedi, but I'm curious if anyone from the ship's crew has come to speak with you yet.
I haven't spoken to any members of the crew. But anyone who needs the help of a Jedi will have it.
No, not yet.
Thank you. I'm glad to hear that.
No member of the ship's crew has sought me out. Should they have?
No, they haven't.
I overheard some passengers talking. You've got quite a reputation. Has the ship's crew spoken to you at all?
Don't be afraid. If there's some kind of trouble, we'll keep you safe.
You seem concerned.
I sense great concern. Why don't you tell us what's wrong?
You seem worried.
You're a Jedi, aren't you? Well, it's a relief to know I'm traveling with such capable people.
This is a Republic vessel. If the crew speaks to anyone, it'll be me.
You should be asking me.
I meant no offense. I was only hoping to confirm something.
I'm pretty sure the crew would come to an experienced captain like me before they talked to this stiff.
Yeah, right.
Of course the crew would be happy for any experienced help they could get.
Why would the crew want to talk to passengers? Is something wrong?
Why do you ask?
If you're so curious about the crew, I suggest you find one of them to bother.
Mind your own business.
I didn't mean to bother you. I thought you might know something about our ship's situation.
I heard a rumor that there's an Imperial warship following us.
I know, I know--the Treaty of Coruscant. But I don't trust the Empire to keep the peace.
We should always be on our guard against the evils of the Sith.
It's good to stay vigilant.
It's wise to anticipate deception by the Sith. But don't let fear cloud your judgment.
You're right to be suspicious.
It's hard not to be a little afraid--knowing what the Empire was capable of back in the war.
Hey, there's nothing wrong with looking over your shoulder every once in a while.
It pays to be cautious.
The Imps will always be a threat--no treaty is going to change that.
Trust me, the war never ended.
It's good to hear I'm not the only one concerned about the Imperials.
Since we don't know for sure the Imperials are following us, let's not worry about it.
I'm sure it's nothing.
I just wish I could get someone from the crew to answer my questions.
Are you still talking?
I just thought that the ship's crew is more likely to talk to someone like you if there's trouble.
The crew won't tell the passengers anything at all. It's not very reassuring.
Telling the passengers that Imperials are nearby would only cause a panic.
They're wise to keep quiet.
I suppose. Still, I think it's unsettling to think that there might be Imperials behind us.
If we're in danger, the crew has a responsibility to tell us.
We have a right to the truth.
Exactly. At least then, we could prepare in case of an attack.
If the Empire wants a fight, we'll give them one.
Bring the Imperials on.
Are you insane? This is a transport, not a warship. We wouldn't stand a chance against them.
Warning! Warning! Incoming fire! All hands, brace for incoming! Repeat, all hands--
Can you hear me? Are you alright?
I'm fine.
Good, good. That was quite a hit, we're lucky not to be hurt.
The Imperials seem to have forgotten about the treaty....
I guess the rumors were true.
I knew the treaty would break eventually, but I didn't think I'd actually be here to see it.
Out of my way, I'm heading for the escape pods!
I'm getting out of here!
The Imperials will blast the pods as soon as they launch--they don't want any witnesses escaping.
Listen--you have to get to the bridge. The captain will need all of the help he can get right now--go, hurry!
Let's just hope it's not too late to help.
I'll head there right away.
It's never too late to try.
Fine, I'll go.
With your skills, I'm sure you could make a difference.
Don't tell me what to do.
I'm not telling you what to do. I'm just saying what I think would be best.
I should head for the bridge and see if there's any way I can lend a hand.
No, you're right.
We're lucky you're here to make a difference.
Nothing much to do here. I might as well go check on the bridge.
I suppose I could help.
It will be a real relief to know that you're helping the crew.
Good luck.
It's not my responsibility to bail you or anyone else out of this.
This isn't my fight.
If you want to stay here and wait to die, fine.
It's your choice. I'm going to see if anyone else was hurt in the attack.
Hello.
